com.mta.tehreer.opentype

Class OpenTypeArtist

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mta.tehreer.opentype.OpenTypeArtist
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class OpenTypeArtist
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    The OpenTypeArtist class represents the text shaping engine.

    • Method Detail

      • finalizable

        public static OpenTypeArtist finalizable(OpenTypeArtist openTypeArtist)
        Wraps an open type artist object into a finalizable instance which is guaranteed to be disposed automatically by the GC when no longer in use. After calling this method, dispose() should not be called on either original object or returned object. Calling dispose() on returned object will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Note: The behaviour is undefined if an already disposed object is passed-in as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        openTypeArtist - The open type artist object to wrap into a finalizable instance.
        Returns:
        The finalizable instance of the passed-in open type artist object.

      • isFinalizable

        public static boolean isFinalizable(OpenTypeArtist openTypeArtist)
        Checks whether an open type artist object is finalizable or not.
        Parameters:
        openTypeArtist - The open type artist object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the passed-in open type artist object is finalizable, false otherwise.

      • getScriptDefaultDirection

        public static TextDirection getScriptDefaultDirection(int scriptTag)
        Returns the default rendering direction of a script.
        Parameters:
        scriptTag - The tag of the script whose default direction is returned.
        Returns:
        The default direction of the script identified by scriptTag.

      • getScriptTag

        public int getScriptTag()
        Returns this artist's current script tag.
        Returns:
        This artist's current script tag.

      • setScriptTag

        public void setScriptTag(int scriptTag)
        Sets this artist's script tag for text shaping. The default value is 'dflt'.

        A tag can be created from string by using OpenTypeTag.make(String) method.

        Parameters:
        scriptTag - The script tag to use for text shaping.

      • getLanguageTag

        public int getLanguageTag()
        Returns this artist's current language tag.
        Returns:
        This artist's current language tag.

      • setLanguageTag

        public void setLanguageTag(int languageTag)
        Sets this artist's language tag for text shaping. The default value is 'dflt'.

        A tag can be created from string by using OpenTypeTag.make(String) method.

        Parameters:
        languageTag - The language tag to use for text shaping.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns this artist's current text.
        Returns:
        This artist's current text.

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets this artist's text to shape while resetting the range to occupy whole text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to shape.

      • setTextRange

        public void setTextRange(int charStart,
                         int charEnd)
        Sets the input range of text to shape.

        The use of this method is preferred over manually taking substrings of continuous text for shaping.

        Parameters:
        charStart - The index to the first character in source text.
        charEnd - The index after the last character in source text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if current text of artist is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if charStart is negative, or charEnd is greater than getText().length(), or charStart is greater than charEnd

      • getTextDirection

        public TextDirection getTextDirection()
        Returns this artist's current text direction.
        Returns:
        This artist's current text direction.

      • setTextDirection

        public void setTextDirection(TextDirection textDirection)
        Sets this artist's text direction for shaping.

        The value of textDirection must reflect the rendering direction of source script so that cursive and mark glyphs are placed at appropriate locations. It should not be confused with the direction of a bidirectional run as that may not reflect the script direction if overridden explicitly.

        Parameters:
        textDirection - The text direction to use for shaping.

      • getTextMode

        public TextMode getTextMode()
        Returns this artist's current text mode.
        Returns:
        This artist's current text mode.

      • setTextMode

        public void setTextMode(TextMode textMode)
        Sets this artist's text mode for shaping.

        This method provides a convenient way to shape a bidirectional run whose direction is opposite to that of script. For example, if the direction of a run, 'car' is explicitly set as right-to-left, backward mode will automatically read it as 'rac' without reordering the original text.

        Parameters:
        textMode - The text mode to use for shaping.

      • fillAlbum

        public void fillAlbum(OpenTypeAlbum album)
        Shapes the specified range of source text with appropriate shaping engine, filling the album with shaping results. The album is cleared first, if not empty.

        The output glyphs in the album flow in logical text direction. For left-to-right direction, the position of pen is incremented with glyph's advance after rendering it. Similarly, for right-to-left direction, the position of pen is decremented with glyph's advance after rendering it.

        Parameters:
        album - The album that should be filled with shaping results.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if either artist's current typeface is null, or artist's current text is null.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if album is null.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases the native memory of this object. Failing to call this method will cause memory leaks.

        Note: The behaviour of this method is undefined if called more than once on the same object.

        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable
